q: The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said.
h:
“The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said.” —
Peter Drucker

q: If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.
h:
“If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.
h:
“Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Youth has no age.
h:
“Youth has no age.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Being a good example is the best form of service.
h:
“Being a good example is the best form of service.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.
h:
“The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.” —
Jim Rohn

q: My sun sets to rise again.
h:
“My sun sets to rise again.” —
Robert Browning

q: The heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care.
h:
“The heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: People acting together as a group can accomplish things which no individual acting alone could ever hope to bring about.
h:
“People acting together as a group can accomplish things which no individual acting alone could ever hope to bring about.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
h:
“Associate with people who are likely to improve you. ” —
Seneca

q: How many times do you have to get hit over the head until you figure out who's hitting you?
h:
“How many times do you have to get hit over the head until you figure out who's hitting you?” —
Harry S. Truman

q: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.
h:
“The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: It is useless to meet revenge with revenge; it will heal nothing.
h:
“It is useless to meet revenge with revenge; it will heal nothing.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
h:
“A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.” —
Osho

q: What worries you, masters you.
h:
“What worries you, masters you.” —
John Locke

q: There's more to life than being a passenger.
h:
“There's more to life than being a passenger.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
h:
“Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice. ” —
Henry Ford

q: If you can change your mind, you can change your life.
h:
“If you can change your mind, you can change your life.” —
William James

q: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
h:
“The best way to predict the future is to create it.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.
h:
“Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.” —
Herodotus

q: You need to be doing fewer things for more effect instead of doing more things with side effects.
h:
“You need to be doing fewer things for more effect instead of doing more things with side effects.” —
Gary Keller

q: The first step is to establish that something is possible; then probability will occur.
h:
“The first step is to establish that something is possible; then probability will occur.” —
Elon Musk

q: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
h:
“Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions.
h:
“Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions.” —
Mark Twain

q: Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.
h:
“Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.” —
Criss Jami

q: Everything will be ok in the end. If it's not ok, it's not the end.
h:
“Everything will be ok in the end. If it's not ok, it's not the end.” —
John Lennon

q: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
h:
“Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.
h:
“Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.
h:
“Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.” —
Dan Brown

q: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
h:
“We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.
h:
“It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.
h:
“Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.” —
Bruce Lee

q: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece
h:
“Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece” —
John Wooden

q: We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.
h:
“We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Be - don't try to become
h:
“Be - don't try to become ” —
Osho

q: Success is built sequentially. It's one thing at a time.
h:
“Success is built sequentially. It's one thing at a time.” —
Gary Keller

q: Words are like Leaves; and where they most abound, Much Fruit of Sense beneath is rarely found.
h:
“Words are like Leaves; and where they most abound, Much Fruit of Sense beneath is rarely found.” —
Alexander Pope

q: What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.
h:
“What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.
h:
“The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: If the grass is greener on the other side, maybe that's because you're not taking good care of your grass.
h:
“If the grass is greener on the other side, maybe that's because you're not taking good care of your grass.” —
Unknown

q: Wherever you are, it's the place you need to be.
h:
“Wherever you are, it's the place you need to be.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.
h:
“Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
h:
“Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
h:
“You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
h:
“Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
h:
“It is better to be looked over than overlooked.” —
Mae West

q: A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.
h:
“A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.” —
Mark Twain

q: He who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead; his eyes are closed.
h:
“He who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead; his eyes are closed. ” —
Albert Einstein

q: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
h:
“A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.” —
Judy Garland

q: You drown not by falling into a river, but by staying submerged in it.
h:
“You drown not by falling into a river, but by staying submerged in it.” —
Paulo Coelho
